reasoning: Building a mobile-first dashboard for field inspectors is a well-scoped frontend feature. The task involves creating new components and routes following existing React patterns in the codebase. No external integrations or infrastructure changes required.

scope.notes: Frontend-focused feature. Will need new page/route, dashboard components, quick action buttons, mobile layout wrapper, and potentially API integration utilities. Backend inspection APIs already exist.

integrations.notes: Uses existing backend inspection APIs. No new external services or dependencies required - React, MUI, and routing libraries are already in place.

infrastructure.notes: Purely frontend implementation. Backend inspection endpoints already exist (inspections.py has comprehensive API routes). No database schema changes needed.

knowledge.notes: Standard React component development using existing patterns. MUI components for UI, React Router for navigation, Axios for API calls - all established in codebase.

concerns: Mobile responsiveness across different device sizes
Understanding inspector workflow from design spec
Quick actions UX must be intuitive for field use
risk.notes: Low technical risk but medium UX risk. Field inspectors need fast, reliable access to key functions. Design spec (10-inspector-mobile.png) must be examined to understand exact requirements.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: New user-facing mobile dashboard requires unit tests for React components and integration tests for API interactions. Mobile responsiveness should be verified. No security-critical changes or infrastructure modifications.
